The Ukrainian #crypto fundraising shows just how generous the community is. 

In fact, there are so many causes that could also benefit from this generosity. 

More charities and causes should accept crypto donations...

1Ô∏è‚É£ Instantly verifiable onchain proof that Ukraine has raised over $20m in #crypto to fund relief

2Ô∏è‚É£ Zero proof that Russia has used crypto to evade sanctions

Yet, politicians, regulators and the MSM are only focusing on one of those...

Turns out "the environment" may be more important than human lives... 

Yet the EU wants to limit proof of work mining based on "ESG concerns". This despite the fact that Ukraine is using #Bitcoin to fund relief. 

Also, as far as I can tell, a mining machine never killed anyone! https://t.co/sG51jPhmfd

#Bitcoin is now trading higher than it was before the Russian invasion... 

There is a reason they call it "Honey Badger" money ü¶° https://t.co/pv862BHAm5

Why should users be banned just because of what passport they hold? Why should ordinary citizens be punished because of the actions of their government? Ban those who have been sanctioned and are responsible, not innocent parties.

My two sats...

The Russian central bank just learnt a very important lesson in self custody. 

Almost two thirds of $640bn in FX reserves that it thought it had to fight a war now can't be accessed. 

Of the sanctions imposed, those on the central bank are likely to be the most severe...

We are only 2 months into this year and already we have seen:

1. A government attempt to freeze crypto donations
2. A government asking for crypto donations

Only one of these two are possible. Other countries should take note & follow Ukraine's lead. You don't have to fight it

Could potential instability in the #crypto market impact on the broader financial markets? Is it systemically linked? That's a case that was recently made by the Financial Stability Board - the topic of my vid today.

If there is one thing that the past week's events have shown us, its the importance of self custody of your #crypto. 

Funds on an exchange are like funds in your bank account. Easily seized by the powers that be...
